metadata.title: Minnesota Produce Packinghouses and Fresh Produce Handlers
metadata.data_source: Minnesota Department of Agriculture, Public Records
metadata.notes: This list represents facilities identified from public sources. Minnesota does not maintain a publicly available comprehensive packinghouse directory. Many facilities may not be listed as they are not required to be public. For complete current list, contact MDA Licensing.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Department of Agriculture - Licensing Database
packinghouses.notes: Online licensing lookup system displays all MDA licensed wholesale food handlers and produce packinghouses. Search by facility name, city, county, or license type. This is the primary resource for finding current licensed facilities.

packinghouses.name: MDA Fruit and Vegetable Inspection Program
packinghouses.notes: USDA-federally licensed inspection and audit program. Provides market inspections, processed inspections at local facilities, shipping point inspections, and GAP/GHP food safety audits for growers, shippers, receivers, and packers.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Wholesale Produce Dealer Program
packinghouses.notes: Licenses wholesale businesses that buy produce directly from farmers and re-sell or distribute farmers' produce. Managed by Farm Products Dealers Trust program.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Co-Packer Directory
packinghouses.notes: Directory of 80+ co-packers (contract manufacturers) in Minnesota and nearby states. Includes facilities offering produce processing, specialty processing (spray-drying, freezing, canning), and value-added produce products.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Farmers' Market Association
packinghouses.notes: Network organization supporting local food producers and farmers' markets. Can provide referrals to produce handlers and packers serving local food systems.

wholesale_food_handler_license.description: Required for operations that hold, store, sell, and/or distribute food to other businesses from permanent location or mobile units
wholesale_food_handler_license.application_process: Contact MDA, determine area inspector, arrange in-person inspection

wholesale_produce_dealer_license.description: For businesses buying produce directly from farmers and re-selling or distributing for commission

potatoes.notes: Minnesota major potato producing state. Daily inspections at local processing facilities for raw potatoes and sweet potatoes. Mandatory certification for Canadian shipments.
potatoes.inspection_service: Available through MDA Fruit and Vegetable Inspection Program

sweet_corn.notes: Minnesota produces significant sweet corn volumes. Processing facilities and packers serve regional and national markets.
sweet_corn.inspection_service: Market and processing facility inspections available

apples.notes: Minnesota apple production with packing and storage facilities. Many with regional distribution.

search_instructions.step_2: Select 'Food Licenses' category from the licensing programs
search_instructions.step_3: Search for 'Wholesale Food Handler' license type to find produce packinghouses
search_instructions.step_4: Filter by city, county, or region to find specific facilities
search_instructions.step_5: Alternative: Contact MDA Licensing directly at 651-201-6062 or mda.licensing@state.mn.us for current facility list

data_limitations.no_public_directory: Minnesota does not publish a comprehensive public packinghouse directory
data_limitations.private_facilities: Some packing operations may not require state licensing if they meet exemptions
data_limitations.contact_required: Most detailed facility information requires direct contact with MDA or individual businesses
data_limitations.recommendation: For complete current list of licensed facilities, use MDA Online Licensing Lookup or contact MDA Licensing department directly
